message.content:
cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.FL, cs.DS, cs.LT. 

The paper deals with the verification and synthesis of liveness properties in recursive programs, which is a topic that falls under the umbrella of formal methods and program analysis. The paper uses techniques such as lasso-finding and summaries, which are commonly used in the verification of finite-state systems. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science), which deals with formal methods and program analysis. The paper also deals with omega-regular languages, which are a topic in automata theory, making cs.PL (Programming Languages) and cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory) likely categories as well. The paper also deals with algorithms and time complexity, making cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) a possible category. Finally, the paper deals with infinite words, making cs.LT (Logic in Theoretical Computer Science) a possible category as well.
